title: CaseInsensitiveStringComparator fails to compare i and I in tr_TR locale
body:
**Describe the bug**

`CaseInsensitiveStringComparator` should treat `i` and `I` equal in `tr_TR` locale.
The bug was identified via https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/pull/2662

See CI output: https://github.com/vlsi/assertj-core/runs/6917023184?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:10831

**Test case reproducing the bug**

Run with `-Duser.country=TR -Duser.language=tr`

```java
  @Test
  void i_and_I_sould_be_equal() {
    assertThat("i").usingComparator(CaseInsensitiveStringComparator.instance).isEqualTo("I");
  }
```

```
org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: 
expected: "I"
 but was: "i"
when comparing values using CaseInsensitiveStringComparator
Expected :"I"
Actual   :"i"
```
